957: Financial Planning and Analysis Director – Program Integrity Aligned Incentives Location : This position will work in a hybrid model (remote and office). The ideal candidate will live within 50 miles of one of our Elevance Health PulsePoint locations and be willing to various time zones to meet the needs of our clients. The Financial Planning and Analysis Director is responsible for providing financial leadership, decision support, and strategic direction to executive leadership and team's achievement of the business plan, with specific emphasis on National and Local Group lines of business. How you will make an impact : Serves as primary liaison between finance leadership and business unit. Building complex financial models in Excel, such as financial projections and valuation models. Create dynamic financial models that incorporate various financial metrics, assumptions, and scenarios to support financial planning and decision-making. Presents month-end financial statements and supporting analysis. Prepares annual and quarterly forecasts. Prepares internal management reports and comprehensive analyses of financial and statistical results to support senior management. Coordinates with actuarial on pricing actions and reserve calculations. Conducts and documents complex financial and business-related analysis. Focuses on business improvement initiatives and leads and directs projects. Minimum Requirements: Requires BA/BS in accounting or finance and a minimum of 5 years of progressively more responsible experience in a high-level financial analysis position; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experiences: CPA certification preferred. Understanding of Payment Integrity and Interplan preferred. In-depth understanding of Excel’s advanced features and functions to manipulate and analyze complex data sets efficiently and create custom formulas highly preferred Financial auditing experience of financial data to ensure their accuracy. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve complex financial issues. Strong written and verbal communication skills to communicate financial information effectively to leadership, colleagues, and other stakeholders. For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $106,400 to $191,520.
